etymologies: 1950s: anglicized singular of modern Latin Streptomyces, from strepto-‘twisted’ + Greek mukēs, mukēt- ‘fungus’

definitions: a bacterium which occurs chiefly in soil as aerobic saprophytes resembling molds, several of which are important sources of antibiotics.

notes.text: Streptomyces and related genera, order Actinomycetales; Gram-positive filaments forming chains of spores

shortDefinitions: bacterium which occurs chiefly in soil as aerobic saprophytes resembling moulds
